<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ECONOMY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/23/jerome-powells-future-fed-chair-uncertain?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Should He Stay or Should He Go?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/23/jerome-powells-future-fed-chair-uncertain?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="A shoulders-up photo of Fed Chair Jerome Powell looking off into the distance" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zMDQxL2plcm9tZV9wb3dlbGwuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Sarah Silbiger/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Fed Chair Jerome Powell’s big policy speech on Friday is like the business world’s Super Bowl, which means endless speculation, gossip, and betting in the week leading up. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">One of the buzziest topics:</strong> Will Powell’s speech be <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/business/economy/fed-chair-powell-s-term-expires-2022-giving-biden-opportunity-n1274088?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">one of his last</a> as Fed Chair? Around Labor Day, President Biden is expected to decide whether to keep Powell in the role after his four-year term expires in February. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Why you should care: </strong>The Fed Chair is the<em> </em>world’s most powerful economic policymaker. Their every word, hand gesture, and stray cough is dissected by investors all over the globe, and Fed Chairs can influence everything from mortgage rates to your grocery bill. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Where is Biden’s head at? </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Most economists think Biden would be <a href="https://www.reuters.com/business/finance/biden-reappoint-jerome-powell-fed-chair-say-economists-2021-07-16/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">scoring an own goal</a> by <em>not </em>reappointing Powell, who is broadly popular. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Biden could also risk angering some people in his cabinet if he switches gears. Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen, who ran the Fed before Powell, has reportedly told White House officials that she <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-08-21/yellen-said-to-back-jerome-powell-reappointment-for-fed-chair?sref=XWHO58FL" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">supports</a> four more years of Powell—an endorsement that significantly boosts his chances of reappointment. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But Powell has plenty of critics, too. The nonpartisan think tank Better Markets <a href="https://www.reuters.com/business/fed-chief-powells-record-mixed-think-tank-says-2021-08-23/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">published a report</a> yesterday that attacks Powell for loosening regulations for big banks and for ignoring pressing climate change risks (popular criticisms of Powell from the left). From the other flank, Powell gets heat for letting inflation rip higher and not acting with more urgency to cool off a potentially too-hot economy.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In general, Powell has gotten high marks even among critics for his handling of the pandemic and for keeping a low profile as former President Trump <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/10/31/trump-rails-against-powell-day-after-fed-cuts-rates-for-a-third-time-this-year.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">bashed him</a> several years ago.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What do you think? </strong>Should Powell get another four years? <a href="https://twitter.com/MorningBrew/status/1429884991589261318?s=20" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Vote here</a>. <em>– NF</em></p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
COVID
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/23/pfizers-covid-vaccine-comirnaty-first-receive-full-fda-approval?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Pfizer's Vaccine Gets Full Approval—and a New Name
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Pfizer’s Covid-19 vaccine <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/health/health-news/fda-grants-full-approval-pfizer-s-covid-vaccine-n1277390?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">received</a> full approval from the FDA yesterday, becoming the first US-made vaccine to move beyond emergency use authorization. Health officials hope that full approval will <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/22/full-vaccine-approval-pfizer-expected-soon-today?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">empower organizations</a> to introduce vax requirements and give hesitant folks more confidence that vaccines are safe and effective.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Here's what happened</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">More mandates did roll out: </strong>NYC and New Jersey <a href="https://www.nbcnewyork.com/news/local/new-jersey-joins-growing-list-of-states-to-require-covid-19-vaccine-for-teachers/3232051/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">announced yesterday</a> that all public school employees will be required to get vaccinated. The Pentagon also announced that a vaccine mandate for all service members would be <a href="https://thehill.com/policy/defense/568996-pentagon-to-mandate-covid-19-vaccine-for-military?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">introduced</a> ASAP.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">It wasn’t even a bit this time:</strong> AMC’s stock jumped nearly 7% after investors predicted that full approval = more vaccinations = more people willing to see <em>Dune</em> in person. Other "reopening" stocks, like airlines and cruises, also got a boost. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Call them by their name:</strong> After gaining full approval in the US, Pfizer will be able to officially market its vaccine by its real name: <a href="https://www.theverge.com/tldr/2021/8/23/22637955/spikevax-moderna-comirnaty-pfizer-fda-approval-names?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Comirnaty</a> (a combination of the words community, immunity, mRNA, and Covid). When it received full approval in the UK, Moderna chose “Spikevax,” which goes harder than a packed basement show. <em>– MM</em></p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPACE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/23/richard-bransons-virgin-orbit-go-public-32-billion-valuation?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Empire SPACs Again
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Virgin Orbit" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xMTAyL3Zpcmdpbl9vcmJpdC5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Virgin Orbit</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Richard Branson ushered in the SPAC boom when he took his space tourism company, Virgin Galactic, public using this unconventional method in 2019. Now he's doubling down with Virgin Orbit, which yesterday said it would <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/boeing-plans-investment-in-virgin-orbits-3-2-billion-spac-listing-11629713303?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">go public</a> via SPAC at a $3.2 billion valuation later this year. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Not to be confused with its sister company Virgin Galactic, Virgin Orbit sends small satellites, not people, to low-earth orbit using modified Boeing 747 jets.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>For most rocket companies of a certain size, SPACs are destiny. Rocket builder Astra hit the market on July 1 via SPAC, and small rocket launcher Rocket Lab will start trading tomorrow. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If these young companies can grab market share, untold riches await.<strong style="color:#000"> </strong>The space industry could be worth <a href="https://www.morganstanley.com/ideas/investing-in-space?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">more than $1 trillion</a> by 2040, with the satellite internet sector making up at least 50% of the entire pie, according to Morgan Stanley.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Virgin Orbit will use its capital infusion to try and catch up to Elon Musk’s SpaceX, the most active US rocket launcher. It’s already sent more than <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/29/spacexs-starlink-internet-service-69420-users?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">1,500 internet-beaming satellites</a> into orbit. <em>– SQ</em></p>

<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/23/key-performance-indicators-august-24?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Key Performance Indicators
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat:</strong> Is the PSL's reign of terror finally over? At Starbucks, Pumpkin Cream Cold Brew <a href="https://finance.yahoo.com/news/starbucks-pumpkin-spice-latte-returns-to-the-menu-others-like-dunkin-panera-release-fall-lineup-130028798.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">outsold</a> the Pumpkin Spice Latte last year. Cold drinks in general accounted for 74% of the company’s beverage sales last quarter, an increase of 10 percentage points from the previous two years. You can order both the PSL and the pumpkin cold brew starting today. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>“We want to have a seat at the table as the crypto economy evolves.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Visa’s head of crypto <a href="https://www.marketwatch.com/story/why-did-visa-just-buy-a-cryptopunk-nft-for-150-000-the-payments-giant-wants-a-seat-at-the-table-as-the-crypto-economy-evolves-11629737832?mod=home-page" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">explained</a> the company’s decision to buy a CryptoPunk NFT for almost $150,000. Visa said it expects other companies to jump on the trend and use NFTs to “express their brand identities and connect with passionate communities of creators and collectors.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>Costa Ricans live longer than us. What’s the secret? (<a href="https://www.newyorker.com/magazine/2021/08/30/costa-ricans-live-longer-than-us-whats-the-secret?utm_source=nextdraft&utm_medium=email" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">New Yorker</a>)</p>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
EDUCATION
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/23/schools-face-severe-bus-driver-shortage-school-year-kicks-off?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
"Want a Job?"
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/23/schools-face-severe-bus-driver-shortage-school-year-kicks-off?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Chris Farley in Billy Madison" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC82MzQ5L2NocmlzX2ZhcmxleV9pbl9iaWxseV9tYWRpc29uLmpwZWciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Billy Madison</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Among the many challenges school districts are facing this fall, a severe <a href="https://apnews.com/article/coronavirus-pandemic-schools-bus-drivers-168e1e85a329c74159c9f06a05d1611d?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">bus driver shortage</a> is at the top of the list. Here’s how bad it is:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Pittsburgh Public Schools delayed its return to the classroom by two whole weeks to buy time and find 400 more drivers. </span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>One Delaware school district is offering to pay parents $700 to take over pickup and dropoff duties for the school year.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>Nearly 80% of school districts said they were having trouble finding bus drivers in March, according to a survey from student rideshare service HopSkipDrive.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">So where did they go? </strong>Take the overall worker shortage as a baseline. Then, <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2021/08/16/school-shortages-bus-drivers-counselors-computer/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">layer on</a> factors like a) logistics companies poaching drivers to handle a surge in deliveries b) some drivers chafing at school bus mask mandates and c) half of the bus driver workforce being over 65, and therefore being more at risk to Covid. <em>– NF</em></p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Brew Mini: </strong>We think some of you might get your fastest scores yet on this puzzle. <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/23/brew-mini-block?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Give it a shot here</a>.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">So Generic </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Pfizer vaccin—er, Comirnaty news has us in the mood for a generic vs. brand name pharmaceutical matching puzzle. We’ll give you a list of brand-name drugs and a list of generic names: Your task is to pair up the drugs that match.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Brand names: </strong>Pepto-Bismol, Tylenol, Motrin, Concerta, Claritin, Tums </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Generics:</strong> Acetaminophen, calcium carbonate, bismuth subsalicylate, loratadine, ibuprofen, methylphenidate</p>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</th>
</tr>
</table>

Vaccine-maker shares, from Pfizer to its partner BioNTech to Moderna, all got a boost.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAfghanistan: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe US brought \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/kabul-fbf81df40a2fc23051c1bb6f4c40693c?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e10,400 people\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e out of Afghanistan over the 24 hours that ended Monday morning, its biggest evacuation day by far. How long the effort will last is still being debated, though. The Taliban have demanded that the US completely pull out of the country by August 31.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c/th\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFed Chair Jerome Powell’s big policy speech on Friday is like the business world’s Super Bowl, which means endless speculation, gossip, and betting in the week leading up. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eOne of the buzziest topics:\u003c/strong\u003e Will Powell’s speech be \u003ca href=\"https://www.nbcnews.com/business/economy/fed-chair-powell-s-term-expires-2022-giving-biden-opportunity-n1274088?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eone of his last\u003c/a\u003e as Fed Chair? Around Labor Day, President Biden is expected to decide whether to keep Powell in the role after his four-year term expires in February. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhy you should care: \u003c/strong\u003eThe Fed Chair is the\u003cem\u003e \u003c/em\u003eworld’s most powerful economic policymaker. Their every word, hand gesture, and stray cough is dissected by investors all over the globe, and Fed Chairs can influence everything from mortgage rates to your grocery bill. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhere is Biden’s head at? \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMost economists think Biden would be \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/business/finance/biden-reappoint-jerome-powell-fed-chair-say-economists-2021-07-16/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003escoring an own goal\u003c/a\u003e by \u003cem\u003enot \u003c/em\u003ereappointing Powell, who is broadly popular. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBiden could also risk angering some people in his cabinet if he switches gears. Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen, who ran the Fed before Powell, has reportedly told White House officials that she \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-08-21/yellen-said-to-back-jerome-powell-reappointment-for-fed-chair?sref=XWHO58FL\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esupports\u003c/a\u003e four more years of Powell—an endorsement that significantly boosts his chances of reappointment. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut Powell has plenty of critics, too. The nonpartisan think tank Better Markets \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/business/fed-chief-powells-record-mixed-think-tank-says-2021-08-23/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epublished a report\u003c/a\u003e yesterday that attacks Powell for loosening regulations for big banks and for ignoring pressing climate change risks (popular criticisms of Powell from the left). From the other flank, Powell gets heat for letting inflation rip higher and not acting with more urgency to cool off a potentially too-hot economy.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn general, Powell has gotten high marks even among critics for his handling of the pandemic and for keeping a low profile as former President Trump \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2019/10/31/trump-rails-against-powell-day-after-fed-cuts-rates-for-a-third-time-this-year.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebashed him\u003c/a\u003e several years ago.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat do you think? \u003c/strong\u003eShould Powell get another four years? \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/MorningBrew/status/1429884991589261318?s=20\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eVote here\u003c/a\u003e. \u003cem\u003e– NF\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nPfizer's Vaccine Gets Full Approval—and a New Name\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003ePfizer’s Covid-19 vaccine \u003ca href=\"https://www.nbcnews.com/health/health-news/fda-grants-full-approval-pfizer-s-covid-vaccine-n1277390?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereceived\u003c/a\u003e full approval from the FDA yesterday, becoming the first US-made vaccine to move beyond emergency use authorization. Health officials hope that full approval will \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/22/full-vaccine-approval-pfizer-expected-soon-today?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eempower organizations\u003c/a\u003e to introduce vax requirements and give hesitant folks more confidence that vaccines are safe and effective.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eHere's what happened\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eMore mandates did roll out: \u003c/strong\u003eNYC and New Jersey \u003ca href=\"https://www.nbcnewyork.com/news/local/new-jersey-joins-growing-list-of-states-to-require-covid-19-vaccine-for-teachers/3232051/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eannounced yesterday\u003c/a\u003e that all public school employees will be required to get vaccinated. The Pentagon also announced that a vaccine mandate for all service members would be \u003ca href=\"https://thehill.com/policy/defense/568996-pentagon-to-mandate-covid-19-vaccine-for-military?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eintroduced\u003c/a\u003e ASAP.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eIt wasn’t even a bit this time:\u003c/strong\u003e AMC’s stock jumped nearly 7% after investors predicted that full approval = more vaccinations = more people willing to see \u003cem\u003eDune\u003c/em\u003e in person. Other \"reopening\" stocks, like airlines and cruises, also got a boost. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eCall them by their name:\u003c/strong\u003e After gaining full approval in the US, Pfizer will be able to officially market its vaccine by its real name: \u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/tldr/2021/8/23/22637955/spikevax-moderna-comirnaty-pfizer-fda-approval-names?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eComirnaty\u003c/a\u003e (a combination of the words community, immunity, mRNA, and Covid). When it received full approval in the UK, Moderna chose “Spikevax,” which goes harder than a packed basement show. \u003cem\u003e– MM\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS Orbit\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eRichard Branson ushered in the SPAC boom when he took his space tourism company, Virgin Galactic, public using this unconventional method in 2019. Now he's doubling down with Virgin Orbit, which yesterday said it would \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/boeing-plans-investment-in-virgin-orbits-3-2-billion-spac-listing-11629713303?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ego public\u003c/a\u003e via SPAC at a $3.2 billion valuation later this year. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNot to be confused with its sister company Virgin Galactic, Virgin Orbit sends small satellites, not people, to low-earth orbit using modified Boeing 747 jets.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eFor most rocket companies of a certain size, SPACs are destiny. Rocket builder Astra hit the market on July 1 via SPAC, and small rocket launcher Rocket Lab will start trading tomorrow. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIf these young companies can grab market share, untold riches await.\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e \u003c/strong\u003eThe space industry could be worth \u003ca href=\"https://www.morganstanley.com/ideas/investing-in-space?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emore than $1 trillion\u003c/a\u003e by 2040, with the satellite internet sector making up at least 50% of the entire pie, according to Morgan Stanley.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eVirgin Orbit will use its capital infusion to try and catch up to Elon Musk’s SpaceX, the most active US rocket launcher. It’s already sent more than \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/29/spacexs-starlink-internet-service-69420-users?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e1,500 internet-beaming satellites\u003c/a\u003e into orbit. \u003cem\u003e– this fall, a severe \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/coronavirus-pandemic-schools-bus-drivers-168e1e85a329c74159c9f06a05d1611d?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebus driver shortage\u003c/a\u003e is at the top of the list. Here’s how bad it is:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003ePittsburgh Public Schools delayed its return to the classroom by two whole weeks to buy time and find 400 more drivers. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eOne Delaware school district is offering to pay parents $700 to take over pickup and dropoff duties for the school year.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eNearly 80% of school districts said they were having trouble finding bus drivers in March, according to a survey from student rideshare service HopSkipDrive.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSo where did they go? \u003c/strong\u003eTake the overall worker shortage as a baseline. Then, \u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2021/08/16/school-shortages-bus-drivers-counselors-computer/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elayer on\u003c/a\u003e factors like a) logistics companies poaching drivers to handle a surge in deliveries b) some drivers chafing at school bus mask mandates and c) half of the bus driver workforce being over 65, and therefore being more at risk to Covid. \u003cem\u003e– NF\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!--
